basics.name: Natasha Taylor
basics.summary: Currently a Research Fellow at National University of Singapore. Short biography for the left-hand sidebar

education.degree: Bachelor of Medical Sciences with First Class Honours

publications.name: Shaking with Fear
publications.summary: This paper is an invited perspective piece on the role of noradrenaline in modulating tremor in Parkinson's Disease.

publications.name: Structural and Functional Correlates of Hallucinations and Illusions in Parkinson’s Disease’
publications.summary: This paper is about structural and functional changes in visual hallucinations in Parkinson's Disease.

publications.name: Limbic hypoconnectivity in idiopathic REM sleep behaviour disorder with impulse control disorders
publications.summary: This paper is about hypoconnectivity changes in REM Sleep Behaviour Disorder.

publications.name: Understanding the effects of serotonin in the brain through its role in the gastrointestinal tract
publications.summary: This paper is a review about the role of serotonin in mediating brain activity through interactions with the gut.

publications.name: The role of the Locus Coeruleus in shaping adaptive cortical melodies
publications.summary: This paper is a review about the role of noradrenaline in faciliating global brain activity for adaptive behaviour.

publications.name: The Contribution of Noradrenergic Activity to Anxiety‐Induced Freezing of Gait
publications.summary: This paper is a about the role of the noradrenergic system in driving anxiety induced freezing of gait in Parkinson's Disease.

publications.name: The Structural and Functional Connectivity of Neuromodulatory systems underpins dynamic shifts in brain network topology and attractor landscape topography
publications.summary: This paper is a about the relationship between noradrenergic and cholinergic structural connectivity faciliates dynamic brain state shifts.

publications.name: A whole new world: embracing the systems-level to understand the indirect impact of pathology in neurodegenerative disorders
publications.summary: This paper is a review paper about embracing systems-level approaches to understanding neuropathology in the brain.

publications.name: Modulating arousal to overcome gait impairments in Parkinson’s disease: how the noradrenergic system may act as a double-edged sword
publications.summary: This paper is a review paper about the role of arousal in gait related impairments in Parkinson's Disease.

publications.name: Abnormal higher-order network interactions in Parkinson’s disease visual hallucinations
publications.summary: This paper is a higher-order cortical changes during visual hallucinations in Parkinson's disease.

publications.name: Effect of dopamine on limbic network connectivity at rest in Parkinson’s disease patients with freezing of gait
publications.summary: This paper is about the effect of dopamine on resting state connectivity in Parkinson's Disease.

publications.name: Causal evidence for cholinergic stabilisation of attractor landscape dynamics
publications.summary: This paper is about the role of the cholinergic system in casually driving brain state shifts.

publications.name: Dopamine alters functional gradients in Parkinson’s disease
publications.summary: This paper is about the dopaminergic related functional gradient changes in Parkinson's Disease.

publications.name: Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI) Signatures of Progression and Phenoconversion in Prodromal Synucleinopathies
publications.summary: This paper is about the prodromal functional changes in prodromal synucleopathies.

publications.name: See through the Static: Reduced Imagery vividness in Aphantasia is associated with impaired temporal lobe signal complexity
publications.summary: This paper is about the functional related complexity changes in Aphantasia.

publications.name: Susceptibility to visual hallucinations in the amyotrophic lateral sclerosis-frontotemporal dementia spectrum: the role of dysfunctional attentional networks
publications.summary: This paper is about the functional changes in visual hallucinations in ALS and dementia.

publications.name: Dysfunctional Preoperative Resting-state Network Connectivity predicts Post-operative delirium
publications.summary: This paper is about the functional connectivity changes that are predictive of post-operative delirium.

publications.name: Preoperative Cholinergic Signatures Drive Segregated Brain Architecture in Postoperative Delirium’
publications.summary: This paper is about the cholinergic alterations as predictor of brain architecture changes in post-operative delirium.
